text: This doesn’t make the captions appear by default. The user needs to click the captions icon to activate them. We want them activated by default. How is this obtained?
Anyone have any insights into how the HubSpot resources page is built? I would like to build something similar but confused how they have managed multiple filters. <https://www.HubSpot.com/resources>

I recently built out a page (<https://www.crayon.co/partners|https://www.crayon.co/partners>) that used hubdb to fetch the data and then I used <https://isotope.metafizzy.co/|isotope> js library to filter. HubSpot is definitely using different js to filter than what I used but I'm not sure exactly what they used without diving into their code.
It looks like they are filtering with dynamic urls

Can anyone knows the way of achieving this. I have number property in contact but when I an fetching this as personalization_token in email and trying to convert it into integer it’s not working.

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/HubSpot-calculated-property/m-p/277055>
Hi Andrew Dunbar, Yes it's possible. this can help you to reach out..., <https://blog.HubSpot.com/marketing/call-to-action-examples>
Honestly will probably just keep it simple and build a listing page with custom tag lists and only allow them to filter by one thing :upside_down_face:
